divs: Sighting DetailsThis is something I saw about three years ago. It seemed highly unusual to me and I tried to figure out exactly what it was, but did not succeed. I don't know that it was a UFO, but I am reporting it here because it has a lot of similarities to the recent report from 2008-11-13 "Facing Tooele" From an elevated point on the east side of the Salt Lake valley I was smoking a cigarette and looking west. I saw a flash above me in my peripheral vision which caused me to immediately look up. Something luminous and blue shot down from directly above me towards the valley. I initially thought that this object would hit the valley and possibly one of the planes I could see in the sky. Instead, the object disappeared behind the mountains making me believe that it had hit Tooele. I now realize that the object may have been much further away than it appeared, but if so it must have been very large. It drew a perfectly straight luminous blue line down from the sky that would have appeared about the width of my pinky finger held at arms length. I reported the object to a group that tracks re-entry of space debris, and I was told there was nothing that would have fallen in that area at that time. I recorded the exact time and date, but I have misplaced that information (at least for now). It may have been a shooting star or a meteorite, but I haven't really found any reported sightings of those things that match what I saw. I found it odd that the 2008-11-13 report was the closest description I've ever found to what I saw, and it seems to have happened at the same angle and at the same place. Seeing this thing was quite a strange surprise. It made me smile.
Summary: Luminous object flies so fast towards the ground that it appears like a blue line from the sky to behind a mountain range. RE: Facing Tooele.
